title: I'm back, and this time, its Hocus pockus remixes
Re: I'm back, and this time, its Hocus pockus remixes
content: Wow, they're really good - proper remixes at last [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]   I especially like Track05, it's a amazing what a good beat can do to improve a song!

title: US Couch Soup
content: Very cruisy. I don't recall the Hocus Pocus music very well, but these are some well made remixes.

title: Re: US Couch Soup
content: Nice job. Are there any more of them?

title: hocus mixes
content:
Oh my god, i tough this thread whas dead..

I don't know when i will mix more

But all thise 2 songs are pure programmed whit pro applications samples, and studio mixing program [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

I programmed the drums by my self from scracth
and manual adjusted the velocity and added some velocity random, to get it more realistic

title: Re: hocus mixes
content:
These are not bad, man! I use virtual GB-sized instruments as well.. what ones did you use?

EDIT: These are REALLY good!!

Reminds me to work on Apogee music sometime.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I should record the HP music from the original MIDI source (Roland Sound Canvas). Sounds awesome on a SC.

I have so many Apogee MIDI's/IMF's.. Must do it generally.

Reminds me, I recorded the Realms of Chaos soundtrack digitally not so long ago as well.


I'll start a new request remix topic though (was going to post it here).

- Spike

title: Re: hocus mixes
content:
Mostly i use Native instruments, and Steinberg VSti

I'm not sure what i used, all i know that is nearly 40 DVD's behind my back, and everthing is VST :P
